private_information: STATEMENT 1: Initial facts are cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_8, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
PLAN 1: wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2, clip object_11 object_4 object_8, wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2, tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_9
actor_A.goal: Analyze STATEMENT 1 and PLAN 1, extract objects, predicates, initial facts, goal, and enumerate required action schema elements without producing PDDL.

private_information: STATEMENT 2: Initial facts are cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
PLAN 2: (no plan provided in the second statement)
actor_B.goal: Analyze STATEMENT 2, extract objects, predicates, initial facts, goal, and enumerate any implications for planning without producing PDDL.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the structured outputs of actor_A and actor_B and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver that achieves the stated goals.

public_information: There is a finite set of objects referenced as object_0 through object_12 across the problem fragments.
Available high-level actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Each action takes a fixed number of object parameters and changes predicates such as next and vase.
Predicates that appear in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring and others referenced in the statements.
Action effects are deterministic and sometimes delete previous facts such as next or vase and sometimes add facts such as next or vase as described in the use-case.
The orchestrator will need to combine facts from multiple statement fragments and respect action preconditions and effects to construct a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward.

analyze.system_prompt: You are actor_A. Read the provided STATEMENT 1 and PLAN 1 from your private information. Extract and output a structured summary that lists all objects mentioned, each initial predicate instance, the explicit goal, and the plan steps as an ordered list. Also enumerate the predicates and action names that appear and any parameter arities you can infer. Do not produce PDDL or domain files; produce structured facts only.
analyze.prompt: Your name is actor_A. Use the public environment information and your private information to extract objects, initial facts, the goal, and the plan steps. Output a concise structured summary named facts_actor_a describing: objects, initial_facts, goal, plan_steps, inferred_predicates, and inferred_action_signatures. Do not emit PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are actor_B. Read the provided STATEMENT 2 from your private information. Extract and output a structured summary that lists all objects mentioned, each initial predicate instance, the explicit goal, and any suggestions for missing plan steps. Also enumerate the predicates and action names that appear and any parameter arities you can infer. Do not produce PDDL or domain files; produce structured facts only.
analyze.prompt: Your name is actor_B. Use the public environment information and your private information to extract objects, initial_facts, the goal, and recommendations for planning. Output a concise structured summary named facts_actor_b describing: objects, initial_facts, goal, plan_suggestions, inferred_predicates, and inferred_action_signatures. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in producing PDDL for the FastDownward planner. Receive the structured summaries from actor_A and actor_B, reconcile object names and predicate uses, resolve any naming mismatches, and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted and the initial states and goals from the inputs. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the structured outputs facts_actor_a and facts_actor_b. Keep multi-agent contributions distinct only where they represent different informational fragments, but produce one unified PDDL domain and one PDDL problem targeting FastDownward that achieves the stated goals. If you need to choose object naming or predicate canonicalization, document your choices in comments in the PDDL problem section. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
